meanings.definition: To detract from the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: Constantly criticizing others only derogates their self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: His constant negative remarks derogate the hard work put into the project.
meanings.sent3: His habit of always pointing out flaws derogates the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions derogate the trust others have in her.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the monument derogates its historical significance.

meanings.definition: To belittle or disparage someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She always derogates her classmates to make herself feel superior.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to derogate others just to boost your own ego.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to derogate his opponent backfired during the debate.
meanings.sent4: The bully's words derogate the confidence of his victims.
meanings.sent5: Using hurtful words to derogate someone is never acceptable.

meanings.definition: To deviate or depart from a standard or norm.
meanings.sent1: The new fashion trend derogates from traditional styles.
meanings.sent2: His decision to derogate from the usual route led to getting lost.
meanings.sent3: The chef's unique recipe derogates from the standard ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The company's innovative approach derogates from industry norms.
meanings.sent5: Sometimes it's good to derogate from the usual routine for a change.
